Event.0: American guitarist and singer B.B. King, who was a principal figure in the development of blues and from whose style leading popular musicians drew inspiration, died in Las Vegas.
Event.1: The last episode of the television situation comedy Seinfeld aired; ostensibly a show about nothing, it was a landmark of American popular culture.
Event.2: Seinfeld's final 2-part episode "The Finale" airs on NBC to 76.3M viewers (commercials priced at $2M for 30 seconds)
Event.3: American singer and actor Frank Sinatra—who, through a long career and a very public personal life, became one of the most sought-after performers in the entertainment industry—died in Los Angeles.
Event.4: Mayflower Madame Sydney Biddle Barrows (42) weds television producer Darnay Hoffman (46) at Cathedral of St. John the Divine in New York City
Event.5:
Mark Zuckerberg
American computer programmer and entrepreneur
was born
Event.6: American computer programmer Mark Zuckerberg, who cofounded the social networking Web site Facebook, was born.
Event.7: Skylab, the first U.S. space station, was launched.
Event.8:
Cate Blanchett
Australian actress
was born
Event.9: NY Yankee Mickey Mantle hits career HR #500 off Baltimore Oriole's Stu Miller
Event.10: Princess Sophia of Greece weds Don Juan Carlos of Spain
Event.11:
David Byrne
Scottish-born musician and interdisciplinary artist
was born
Event.12:
Robert Zemeckis
American director and screenwriter
was born
Event.13: Israel declares independence from British administration
Event.14:
Declaration of Israel's statehood
On this day in 1948—just before the expiry of the British mandate in Palestine—David Ben-Gurion and the Jewish People's Council proclaimed the establishment of the State of Israel, precipitating the first Arab-Israeli war.
Event.15:
George Lucas
American director, producer, and screenwriter
was born
Event.16: Felix Mendelssohn's concert overture "Hebrides" premieres in London
Event.17: Meriwether Lewis and William Clark embarked from the American Midwest on their famous expedition to the Pacific coast of North America.
Event.18: Meriwether Lewis & William Clark's expedition commissioned by Thomas Jefferson sets out from St Louis for Pacific Coast
Event.19: Edward Jenner administered the first vaccination against smallpox.
Event.20: English country doctor Edward Jenner administers the first inoculation against smallpox, using cowpox pus, in Berkeley, Gloucestershire
Event.21: Delegates gather in Philadelphia to draw up US constitution
Event.22: Robert Owen, a manufacturer-turned-reformer who was one of the most-influential utopian socialists of the early 19th century, was born in Newtown, Wales.
Event.23: King of France Louis XVIII weds princess Maria Giuseppina of Savoy at the Palace of Versailles
Event.24: Four-year-old Louis XIV ascended the throne of France.
Event.25: The first permanent British settlement in North America was founded at Jamestown, Virginia.
